title._content: [William Albert Smoot, Jr., house, 220 North Washington Street, Alexandria, Virgina. (LOC)

description._content: Johnston, Frances Benjamin,, 1864-1952,, photographer. [William Albert Smoot, Jr., house, 220 North Washington Street, Alexandria, Virgina. Rose garden] [1920] 1 photograph : glass lantern slide, hand-colored ; 3.25 x 4 in. Notes: Site History. House architecture: Georgian style brick house built circa 1796. Associated Name: Harriet Ansley (Mrs. William A.) Smoot Jr. Other: Also known as Lloyd house. Purchased by William A. Smoot Jr. in 1916. Today: House extant. Slide for lecturing on city and suburban gardens. On slide (handwritten): "S" and "Smoot." Also, blue star sticker. Title, date, and subject information provided by Sam Watters, 2011. Forms part of: Garden and historic house lecture series in the Frances Benjamin Johnston Collection (Library of Congress). Published in Gardens for a Beautiful America / Sam Watters. New York: Acanthus Press, 2012. Plate 232. Rights Info: No known restrictions on publication. Repository: Library of Congress, Prints and Photographs Division, Washington, D.C. 20540 USA, hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/pp.print Higher resolution image is available (Persistent URL): hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/ppmsca.16655 Call Number: LC-J717-X107- 11
